ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The SmithFoods Richmond Inc., located in Richmond, Indiana, provides refrigeration for frozen desserts and dairy products.  The SmithFoods Richmond senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but also maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  The Smith Dairy, Wayne Division administers safety and environmental policies at the facility to ensure compliance with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) and EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP).  These programs include forklift safety, hazard communications, lockout/tagout, employee safety manuals, manufacturer's documentation, and the Emergency Response Plan. Portions of our programs have been extended to include a non-covered process

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

The SmithFoods Richmond Inc. is located at 1590 N.W. 11th Street in Richmond, Indiana.  The facility is ammonia refrigeration system was designed and constructed in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.

The system uses 17,000 pounds of ammonia to provide refrigeration for frozen desserts and dairy products.  The majority of the system including vessels and compressors is located inside and outside of the facility building.  The condensers are mounted on the roof and all of the evaporators are located in their respective freezer/cold storage areas.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

SmithFoods Richmond Inc. ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system. For example, the SmithFoods Richmond Inc. facility operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.

Other safety features of the ammonia refrigeration system include: ammonia sensors that sou

nd a facility-wide alarm, an emergency shutdown button that kills power to engine room equipment, relief valves on all pressure vessels, and continuous ventilation in the engine room to prevent ammonia explosions.

In addition to the International Mechanical Code, the facility has based its maintenance program on the industry standard: The International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines.  In particular, the IIAR Bulletin 110, "Startup, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia Refrigeration Systems' is used at the facility.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

An investigation into the SmithFoods Richmond Inc. accident history showed that there had been no reportable accidents with ammonia in the last 5 years. A fire without an ammonia release occurred in (November 2013) In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from an ammonia incident.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

SmithFoods Richmond Inc. has an emergency action plan in effect at the facility.  The Emergency Response Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Action section of the PSM document, which is maintained at the facility. This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:

  1.)  To save lives.
  2.)  To minimize and avoid injuries.
  3.)  To protect the environment.
  4.)  To minimize property damage.

The SmithFoods Richmond Inc. maintains a PSM team whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate facility changes due to the renovation of the facility.
